techmeme.title: Q&A with Nintendo of America VP of Product Bill Trinen on pricing first-party games like Mario Kart World at $80, Joy-Con 2 and using it as a mouse, and more (Logan Plant/IGN)
Chinese media outlet Caijing: Microsoft's joint venture Wicresoft will cease its China operations from April 8 after stopping outsourcing after-sales support (Reuters)
US tech stocks fall for a third session after Trump's tariffs as markets open: Apple and Tesla drop 5%+, while Meta, Amazon, Microsoft, and Alphabet fall ~1% (Samantha Subin/CNBC)
Nintendo of America President Doug Bowser says the company is "actively assessing" the impact of US tariffs, and they "weren't factored into" Switch 2 pricing (Megan Farokhmanesh/Wired)
Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman says an "off-frontier" strategy of building models "three or six months behind" cuts costs and helps focus on some use cases (Jordan Novet/CNBC)
